page.title: 04Farming in Bwlchysarnau
page.content: Farming is the major occupation and landuse of the area, which consists of marginal land with sheep farming predominating along with some beef cattle. Only 1 farm has a dairy herd. E.E.C. grants have helped to produce a marked improvement in fencing, drainage and access roads, leading to increased stocking rates on the improved fields. Some fodder crops of barley, swedes and rape are occasionally grown. Lambing, shearing and hay-making are the busiest times of the year.Lambing often occurs indoors in special sheds to enable the farmer to supervise the sheep easily. Shearing is either done by the farmer himself or a contractor. Haymaking is becoming increasingly mechanised.Many of the farmers also make silage.
